instructions: Download Accessibility Scanner from Google Play . Open Accessibility Scanner . Follow the prompts to turn on Accessibility Scanner in your device's Settings app. Tap Accessibility , then tap Accessibility Scanner . Tap Use service .

Open your app. Tap the Accessibility Scanner button . Tap Record . Start using your app. If you go to another app, the recording pauses until you return. To stop recording, swipe down from the top of your screen to open your notifications. Tap Accessibility Scanner is recording , then tap Stop .
Open your app. Tap the Accessibility Scanner button . Tap Snapshot .

On your device, go to the Apps section. Tap Accessibility Scanner . Tap Settings . View or change the following settings: Contrast ratio : Set a new minimum threshold for text and image contrast. Touch target size : Set a new minimum threshold for touch target size.
After scanning your app, tap Share . Choose how you want to share the zip file with the results and screenshots.
On your device, go to the Apps section. Tap Accessibility Scanner . The History displays a list of scans with their times and dates. To see details, tap a scan.
